title: Casca Wines 2015 Cascas Winemaker Selection Rosé (Douro)
description: Red-cherry flavors dominate this soft fruity wine. It is aromatic, full of ripe fruitiness and with just the right touch of acidity. Drink now.

title: Bouchard Aîné et Fils 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé
description: Round and fruity, this offers gentle acidity and ripe melon fruit. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Christophe Pertuzot 2014  Chorey-lès-Beaune
description: This wine is tight and tannic, firm and missing fruit. It seems to have been heavily extracted, giving a bitter character to the wine. It could soften, although that is difficult to imagine.

title: Los Clop 2012 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Deep purple in color, with jammy boysenberry aromas, this smells like it has a burnt topping. Formless on the palate, this is mostly a big, extracted, scattered Malbec that's grapy and dark but devoid of complexities.

title: Los Pinos Ranch 2014 Blanco Grande Estate Grown Blanc du Bois (Texas)
description: Canned lychee and lemongrass feels a bit thick and heavy on the nose. The palate follows suit and is medium in weight, yet lags a little in acidic verve.

title: Lost Oak 2014 Red Roan Red (Texas High Plains)
description: Overripe berries take on an almost compote character, giving a saucy depth to the nose. The palate follows suit, remaining heavy in feel and slightly charred on the finish.

title: Kiwi Cuvée 2015 Bin 086 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)
description: Light scents of lime, white melon rind, green gooseberry and fresh-cut grass dance on the nose of this dainty white, followed by flavors of underripe pear and tart currant on the light-weight palate. It's fresh and lively, finishing short but clean. Drink up.

title: Jean-Paul Paquet 2014 Domaine des Vieux Murs  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
description: This soft wine has ripe melon and pear flavors only lightly cut with citrus acidity. It is easy to drink and ready now.

title: J.P. Chenet 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Vin de France)
description: This is a solid and balanced wine, with lively aromas and flavors of red cherry, strawberry and banana. Light weight and easy drinking, the softly tannic structure transitions seamlessly into the clean, fruity finish.

title: Manciat-Poncet 2014 Les Crays  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
description: Soft and round, this has gentle fruitiness and a touch of spice. It is an easy, open wine that is ready to drink.

title: Oak Grove 2014 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This light-bodied wine smells like honeydew melon and canteloupe and tastes almost sweet. The texture falls between bright and rich.

title: Quinta da Lapa 2013 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)
description: There was probably too much wood aging of this wine. It shows in the woody character which threatens to smother the black-currant fruit. The acidity at the end helps to give the wine some attraction.

title: Quinta da Raza 2015 Dom Diogo Padeiro Colheita Seleccionada Rosé (Vinho Verde)
description: There is an attractive light sparkle to this off-dry rosé. It has strawberry fruit and a touch of acidity that balances the candied softness. Drink now.

title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2015 Terra de Lobos Branco White (Tejo)
description: A blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Fernão Pires where the blend produces a wine that is soft and gently fruity. It has attractive acidity as well as a touch of spice and intense citrus at the end. Drink now.

title: Rosemont 2013 Merlot (Virginia)
description: Underripe red plum and currant aromas are flecked with prickly fern notes on the nose. The light-bodied palate is marked by tart red berries and bitter green stems.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Casa Ermelinda Freitas Monte de Baía Branco White (Península de Setúbal)
description: A local blend of Arinto and Fernão Pires, the wine is soft, fruity with pear and melon fruit. It has gentle acidity and a crisp texture that gives a lift to the aftertaste. Drink now.
designation: Casa Ermelinda Freitas Monte de Baía Branco

title: Rosemont 2013 Kilravock Red (Virginia)
description: This blend of 33% Cabernet Franc, 27% Merlot, 27% Petit Verdot and 13% Cabernet Sauvignon is mildly concentrated on the nose and palate, with rubbery blackberry, cranberry juice and geranium leading the way. Light bodied, with a soft grip of tannins, these flavors lead to a short finish of green peppercorn.

title: Callaway 2014 Special Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: Sharp aromas of cut grass and pencil eraser show on the nose of this tart, sour wine. Dried lime peels and a slight rubber quality make for a somewhat bitter sip, though certainly reminiscent of the grape.

title: Coeur de Terre 2015 Rustique Rosé (Willamette Valley)
description: The first impression is that this is slightly off dry. It's a 50-50 blend of saignéed Syrah and lightly pressed Pinot Noir. It's tannic and disjointed, with sour watermelon and lemon flavors, despite that first hint of sweetness.

title: Delfosse 2013 Petit Verdot (Monticello)
description: A veil of tilled earth and slight funk lies over rubbery red-berry aromas. Medium in weight, with mild tannic grip, this Petit Verdot has a soft palate of tart red fruit, flecked by astringent green notes.

title: Chamlija 2015 Blanc de Noirs Papaskarasi (Thrace)
description: This lightly pressed white version of an indigenous red grape is pale-straw in color, with a nose of lemon. It is slightly stiff on the palate, with flavors of lemon and peach and a refreshing, almost effervescent finish.

title: Aveleda 2015 Casal Garcia Rosé (Vinho Verde)
description: This popular brand's pink version is off dry, lightly fizzy and fruity. It has a strawberry-sherbet character that is attractive and great for summer drinking.

title: Bending Branch 2014 Riven Rock Vineyard Viognier (Texas Hill Country)
description: Waxy crayon, petrol and steely lemon aromas mark the closed bouquet. The palate shows some decent weight, yet disparate acids give a sharp feeling. Citrus races from start to finish, with a slight char marking the close.

title: Moscato Bella 2013 Muscat Canelli (California)
description: This is a very sweet wine, with aromas like cotton candy and marshmallows, flavors like extra-sweet lemonade, and a syrupy texture.

title: Golan Heights Winery 2014 Yarden Odem Vineyard Chardonnay (Galilee)
description: Medium-yellow in color, this wine has a bouquet of citrus fruits with a whiff of petrol. It is a little stiff on the palate, with flavors of lemon, custard apple and thyme.

title: Pasaeli 2015 Yapincak (Thrace)
description: This wine has a nose of soft citrus and tropical fruits. It is very soft on the palate, with flavors of citrus, jasmine, acacia flower, lemon rind, and apple cider.

title: La Bioca 2013  Barbaresco
description: French oak, coconut and roasted coffee bean aromas dominate the nose. The bracing palate offers oak extract, raw cherry, sour cranberry, a green note of powdered sage and oak-driven spice. It lacks the fruit richness needed to stand up to the oak while raspy tannins leave an extremely astringent finish and dry out the tongue.

title: La Vieille Ferme 2015 White (Vin de France)
description: Crisp aromas of lemon, melon rind and underripe pear are not overly intense but at the center of the bouquet. The palate is light weight and accessible, with similarly easy flavors that carry through to the clean and mouthwatering finish.

title: Kaiken 2014 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Jammy, brambly aromas of grassy blueberry and balsamic vinegar make for a rough entry. This feels chunky, grabby and hard, while flavors of lactic oak and herbal blueberry are strained. A spicy, green-leaning finish comes with a final dose of hard tannins.

title: Christie's NV Butler Nephew & Co Tawny Finest Reserve  (Port)
description: This is a young- looking wine that tastes equally fresh. Red fruits and soft tannins are balanced with acidity It tastes too young to be a true tawny with no hint of any nutty maturity.
designation: Butler Nephew & Co Tawny Finest Reserve
